function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential for the spread of contagious diseases due to changes in social practices and public movements.","Impact":"Uncontrolled spread of contagious diseases can lead to health crises and overwhelm healthcare systems.","Mitigation":"Promotion of hygienic practices, vaccination campaigns, and public health education to prevent the spread of contagious diseases.","Technologies":"Health monitoring technology, contact tracing apps, and air filtration systems to reduce the risk of disease transmission.","People":"General public, political leaders, and public health authorities.","Owner":"Public health authorities, government agencies, and international organizations."},{"Description":"Socio-technical lock-ins leading to limited flexibility in transitioning to sustainable energy practices.","Impact":"Resistance to change and dependence on existing energy systems may hinder the transition to sustainable energy solutions.","Mitigation":"Investment in innovative energy technologies, policy incentives for sustainable energy adoption, and awareness campaigns to promote behavioral change.","Technologies":"Renewable energy sources, energy storage systems, and smart grid technologies to facilitate sustainable energy transitions.","People":"Energy consumers, industry stakeholders, and policymakers.","Owner":"Energy companies, research institutions, and government bodies."},{"Description":"Policy responses to the Covid-19 pandemic influencing the pace of sustainable energy transitions.","Impact":"Ineffective or slow policy responses can delay progress in achieving sustainable energy goals, while proactive policies can accelerate the transition to sustainable energy.","Mitigation":"Collaboration between government, industry, and community stakeholders to develop responsive and effective policies for sustainable energy transitions.","Technologies":"Data analytics for policy development, digital communication platforms for stakeholder engagement, and energy efficiency technology for rapid deployment.","People":"Government officials, industry leaders, and community advocates.","Owner":"Government agencies, industry associations, and energy innovation organizations."}]}
